trans-unit.source: Manages a set of parser errors detected during parsing.
This class cannot be inherited.
The <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> class provides methods and properties that you can use to manage a collection of <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects.

For example, you can add a set of parser errors to a collection upon parsing while using a custom <xref:System.Web.Compilation.BuildProvider> object to report all parse exceptions caught during parsing.
To add parser errors to, remove them from, or locate them in a collection, use the following:
The <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method to add a single <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> methods to add multiple <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects to the collection.

Both the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Insert%2A> method and the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Item%2A> property, which is the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> indexer, to add a single <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection at the specified index.
Additionally, you can use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection> class to do the following:
Remove <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects with the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method.
Check whether a particular <xref:System.Web.ParserError> is in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Contains%2A> method.
Find where a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object is located in the collection by using the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserErrorCollection"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserErrorCollection"></xref> class.
The <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=fullName> constructor adds an array of <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects to the collection.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> that specifies the errors to add to the collection.
Adds a value to the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method to add an existing <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection.
You cannot add the same <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection more than once.
When you call the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method using a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object that is already in the collection, the addition fails and -1 is returned.
To add multiple objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> value to add to the collection.
The index of the value within the collection; otherwise, -1 if the value is already in the collection.
Adds an array of <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> objects to the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add an array of <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects to the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> method is useful when you create multiple <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects and want to add them to the collection with a single method call.
To add individual <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects to the collection, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> that specifies the values to add to the collection.
value is `null`.
Adds the objects in an existing <xref href="System.Web.ParserErrorCollection"></xref> to the collection.

Unlike the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method, the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> method does not have a return value that can be used to determine whether a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object being added is already in the collection.
If you need this information, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Contains%2A> method before using <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A>.
A <xref href="System.Web.ParserErrorCollection"></xref> containing the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> objects to add to the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> value is `null`.
Determines whether the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object is located in the collection.
You cannot add the same <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection more than once.
However, attempting to add a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object more than once will not throw an exception.
Instead, the addition will fail.
In this case, the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Add%2A> method will return a value of â€“1.
However, the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> and <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Insert%2A> methods do not have return values.

When adding <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects by using one of these methods, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Contains%2A> method to determine whether a particular <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object is already in the collection.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> to locate in the collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> is in the collection; otherwise, `false`.
Copies the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> objects in the collection to a compatible one-dimensional array, starting at the specified index of the target array.

Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.CopyTo%2A> method to copy the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects in a collection (including the item references they contain) to a compatible array, starting at a specified index.
This is useful when you want to sort the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects in the collection by using the <xref:System.Array.Sort%2A> method.
To do this:
Copy the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects into a compatible array.
Sort the array.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove all the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> objects from the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.AddRange%2A> method to add the sorted array back to the collection.
An array of type <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> to which the parser errors in the collection are copied.
The first index within the array to which the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> is copied.
Gets the index of the specified <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object in the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.IndexOf%2A> method to determine the index of a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object within the collection.

This is useful to determine the index of each <xref:System.Web.ParserError>when you iterate through the collection by using the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> object returned by the <xref:System.Collections.CollectionBase.GetEnumerator%2A> method.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> to locate in the collection.
The zero-based index of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> objects within the collection; otherwise, 1 if the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> is not in the collection.
Inserts the specified <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object into the collection at the specified index.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Insert%2A> method to insert an existing <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object at a particular index within the collection.
You cannot add the same <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object to the collection more than once.
When you call the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Insert%2A> method by using a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> that is already in the collection, the insertion fails.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Contains%2A> method before the insertion to determine whether a particular <xref:System.Web.ParserError> is already in the collection.

To reposition a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> within the collection, you must first remove it by using the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method and then insert it at the desired index by using <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Insert%2A>.
The index within the collection at which to insert the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object to insert into the collection.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object at the specified index within the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Item%2A> property to retrieve the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object at the specified index within the collection.
When you have a reference to the <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object and need the index, use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.IndexOf%2A> method.
The index within the collection of the <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object to get or set.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> at the specified index within the collection.
Removes the specified <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> object from the collection.
Use the <xref:System.Web.ParserErrorCollection.Remove%2A> method to remove a <xref:System.Web.ParserError> object from the collection when you have a reference to the <xref:System.Web.ParserError>.
The <xref href="System.Web.ParserError"></xref> to remove from the collection.
